section.title: Use Case 1: Read existing HSSF

ul.li: HSSF client- wants to read content of HSSF file
POIFS - understands underlying POI file system

ol.li: HSSF client requests HSSF to read a HSSF file, providing an InputStream containing HSSF file in question.
HSSF requests POIFS to read the HSSF file, passing the InputStream object to POIFS (POIFS use case 1, read existing file system)
HSSF reads the "Workbook" file (use case 4, read workbook entry)

section.p: 2a. Exceptions thrown by POIFS will be passed on to the HSSF client.

section.title: Use Case 2: Write HSSF file

ul.li: HSSF client- wants to write file out.
HSSF - knows how to write file out.
POIFS - knows how to write file system out.
File has been read (use case 1, read existing HSSF file) and subsequently modified or file has been created (use case 3, create HSSF file)

ol.li: HSSF client provides an OutputStream to write the file to.
HSSF writes the "Workbook" to its associated POIFS file system (use case 5, write workbook entry)
HSSF requests POIFS to write its file system out, using the OutputStream obtained from the HSSF client (POIFS use case 2, write file system).

section.p: 3a. Exceptions from POIFS are passed to the HSSF client.

ul.li: HSSF client- wants to create a new file.
HSSF - knows how to create a new file.
POIFS - knows how to creat a new file system.

ol.li: HSSF requests POIFS to create a new file system (POIFS use case 3, create new file system)

section.title: Use Case 4: Read workbook entry

ul.li: HSSF - knows how to read the workbook entry
POIFS - knows how to manage the file system.
The file system has been read (use case 1, read existing HSSF file) or has been created and written to (use case 3, create HSSF file system; use case 5, write workbook entry).

ol.li: HSSF requests POIFS for the "Workbook" file
POIFS returns an InputStream for the file.
HSSF reads from the InputStream provided by POIFS
HSSF closes the InputStream provided by POIFS

section.p: 3a. Exceptions thrown by POIFS will be passed on

ul.li: HSSF - knows how to manage the write the workbook entry.
POIFS - knows how to manage the file system.
Either an existing HSSF file has been read (use case 1, read existing HSSF file) or an HSSF file has been created (use case 3, create HSSF file).

ol.li: HSSF checks the POIFS file system directory for the "Workbook" file (POIFS use case 8, read file system directory)

If "Workbook" is in the directory, HSSF requests POIFS to replace it with the new workbook entry (POIFS use case 4, replace file in file system). Otherwise, HSSF requests POIFS to write the new workbook file, with the name "Workbook" (POIFS use case 6, write new file to file system)
